Activity: Arrive at the hospital, check emails, and review any updates on influenza protocols or EHR system changes. Listen to an upbeat song on the way to work.
As it's the end of the week, dedicate some time to reviewing all the influenza-related EHR entries I've made. Look for any recurring errors or areas where I can improve my documentation accuracy.
Begin patient rounds. Prioritize patients with respiratory symptoms or those who are considered high-risk. Focus on accurate symptom assessment and EHR documentation.
Assess Patient 13 (Mr. Anderson) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
Assess Patient 14 (Ms. Martinez) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR using the standardized tool.
If influenza testing is needed, collect samples and ensure proper labeling and delivery to the lab.
Continue patient rounds and accurate EHR documentation.
Lunch break. Plan my weekend activities.
Resume patient rounds and influenza symptom assessment, focusing on high-risk patients.
Assess Patient 15 (Mrs. White) for influenza symptoms. Document all findings in the EHR.
Review Patient 13's (Mr. Anderson) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Review Patient 14's (Ms. Martinez) EHR entry for completeness and accuracy.
Follow up on lab results and document accurately in the EHR.

Send a summary report to @da-1 and @da-2 outlining the number of influenza assessments conducted this week and any trends observed in symptoms or vaccination status. Topic: Weekly Influenza Assessment Summary
Prepare for shift change and communicate relevant patient information to the incoming nurse.
Final documentation and EHR review before leaving for the day. Make sure to wish my colleagues a good weekend.
